sn3.20:1.1: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala went up to the Buddha in the middle of the day … The Buddha said to him,
sn3.20:1.2: “So, great king, where are you coming from in the middle of the day?”
sn3.20:2.1: “Sir, here in Sāvatthī a financier householder has passed away.
sn3.20:2.2: Since he died childless, I have come after transferring his fortune to the royal compound.
sn3.20:2.3: There was ten million in gold, not to mention the silver.
sn3.20:2.4: And yet that financier ate meals of
sn3.20:2.8: He traveled around in a vehicle that was
sn3.20:2.9: a dilapidated little cart, holding a leaf as sunshade.”
sn3.20:3.1: “That’s so true, great king! That’s so true!
sn3.20:3.2: Once upon a time, great king, that financier householder provided alms-food on behalf of a Buddha awakened for himself named Tagarasikhī.
sn3.20:3.3: He instructed: ‘Give alms to that ascetic,’ before getting up from his seat and leaving.
sn3.20:3.4: But after giving he regretted it:
sn3.20:3.5: ‘It would have been better to feed the bondservants or workers with that alms-food.’
sn3.20:3.6: What’s more, he murdered his brother’s only child for the sake of his fortune.
sn3.20:4.1: Because that financier provided Tagarasikhī with alms-food, as a result of that deed he was reborn seven times in a good place, a heavenly realm.
sn3.20:4.2: And as a residual result of that same deed he held the position of financier seven times right here in Sāvatthī.
sn3.20:4.3: But because that financier regretted giving alms,
sn3.20:4.4: as a result of that deed his mind didn’t tend to enjoy nice food, clothes, vehicles, or the five refined kinds of sensual stimulation.
sn3.20:4.5: And because that financier murdered his brother’s only child for the sake of his fortune, as a result of that deed he burned in hell for many years, for many hundreds, many thousands, many hundreds of thousands of years.
sn3.20:4.6: And as a residual result of that same deed, he is childless for the seventh time, his fortune ending up in the royal treasury.
sn3.20:4.7: Now the old merit of that financier has been used up, and he hasn’t accumulated new merit.
sn3.20:4.8: Today, great king, that financier burns in the Great Hell of Screams.”
sn3.20:4.9: “Really, sir, that financier has been reborn in the Great Hell of Screams?”
sn3.20:4.11: That is what the Buddha said. …
